details.full_description:
Probiotics are GRAS (Generally Recognized As Safe). They're bacteria that provide greater health benefits such as better digestion and a stronger immune system. The most common probiotics that manufacturers add to commercial products are species of Bifidobacterium and Lactobacillus bacteria.
Some yogurts, supplements, and fermented foods, including kefir, sauerkraut, and tempeh, contain probiotics.


Health benefits of probiotics include aiding digestion, lowering blood pressure, improving cognitive function, and alleviating irritable bowel syndrome.
